data.title: Cross-mod texture bogosity
data.body:
After switching from TD to RA, I found the RA menu background was rendered using the minimap sheet texture instead of the expected artwork.

I'm not sure how to repro this, but I suspect it is a regression from #6830.

Remove BOM

data.title: Replaced GitHub access token
data.body: This is a related security issue such as https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRAWeb/pull/179 and I also took the time to give access to the @orabot account instead of myself. I already revoked all my GitHub access tokens so you can't use GitHub releases until this is merged.

data.title: add "dependencies" to "make all"
data.body: make all does build the game, and another few things which are required for that. This should be "make game" but we named it "make all" so we should also copy the dependecies (before compiling).

data.title: Stylecop fix
data.body: Fix StyleCop warnings

data.title: Fixed high CPU usage due to Socket.Select not blocking the thread properly when the game started
data.body: As discussed in #7237.

data.title: Busy loop in server.cs (High CPU usage)
data.body:
problem:
CPU usage over 100% (shown in `top`)

step to reproduce:
1. start game using mono (`mono OpenRA.Game.exe`)
2. start a skirmish (then check CPU usage)

cause:
After starting the game (match/skirmish), the [server/listener (TcpListener) would stop](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Game/Server/Server.cs#L656), the stopped TcpListener somehow cause the [Socket.Select](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Game/Server/Server.cs#L163) not to block and thus resulting a busy loop (High CPU usage)

possible solution:
1. use `Thread.Sleep` in the loop
2. exclude `listener.Server` from the checkRead after the game started,  note: there MUST be some kind of check to prevent `System.ArgumentNullException: All the lists are null or empty.` (and maybe also a Thread.Sleep)

system:
fedora 21 (linux)
mono 2.10.8 (on 29/12/2014) and mono 3.10.0 (from 30/12/2014)
opengl 2.1

the different version of mono is cause pchote suggested that it could be the reason to the high cpu load so i updated it on 30/12/2014

i also notice it long ago when i was using fedora 19 (i don't remember the mono version) but back then, i just thought it was cause my laptop wasn't powerful enough.

notes:
i am able to reproduce the busy loop using this code: http://asl97.pythonanywhere.com/paste/cpp/7a9d9bd1-d5c0-43bc-a49e-13fc86d12b01

this problem might have existed since [May 26, 2012](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/commit/3f0fafb3801a92d9ee6d5f3e73dcdeff6db31954#diff-e34ac0a837f43698d67024b60cd1cf12R425)

irc: (find `asl97` for my chat messages)
[29/12/2014](http://logs.openra.net/index.php?year=2014&month=12&day=29)
[30/12/2014](http://logs.openra.net/index.php?year=2014&month=12&day=30)
[31/12/2014](http://logs.openra.net/index.php?year=2014&month=12&day=31)

data.title: Dogs jump loop
data.body:

data.title: Improve YAML parse time.
data.body: Stream lines to avoid needing to load the whole file first, and avoid a LINQ Contains call when string.IndexOf will be much faster.

data.title: Checked LINQ queries and collections for inefficiencies.
data.body:
- Made Array.IndexOf available via extension method.
- Made ToHashSet extension method.
- Change collections queried often via Contains into sets.
- Avoid Count() extension if Count or Length property exist.
- Made Count() > 0 checks and variations calls to Any() instead.
- Don't call ToList/ToArray if there is no benefit to materializing the sequence.
- If the sequence does benefit from materialization, follow this general pattern:
  - Collection queried often via Contains use ToHashSet to speed up lookups.
  - Short lived variables use ToList. This is because ToArray requires an extra copy to output the final size.
  - Collections persisted into fields or for a long time use ToArray to minimize memory overhead.

data.title: Make OccupiedCells implementations return arrays.
data.body:
Since there are only one or two items, it's cheaper to return a concrete collection and avoid the overhead of the compiler generated state machine.

This in particular speeds up Shroud.GetVisOrigins when dealing with Mobile.OccupiedCells, as the expensive CanEnterCell call is made only once rather than twice.

data.title: Introduce a new type for representing map coordinates.
data.body:
To resolve the ambiguity introduced when the introduction of isometric maps meant that cell and map coordinates were no longer equivalent, a new type has been introduced so they can each be represented separately.

The MPos type represents map coordinates. I have moved the static MapToCell and CellToMap methods into instance methods against the CPos and MPos types. I'll probably implement more changes at some point to reduce the number of conversions where possible, but I'd just like to get map coords in the door for now so to speak.

I played a quick round of TS and things looked okay to me.

data.title: Removed the redundant OnRails
data.body: It was superseded by https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits#rejectsorders long ago.

data.title: add scroll buttons that appear in the production palette when icons exceed available space
data.body: Closes #7159

data.title: Slot Admin lobby dropdown should be disabled when no options are available
data.body: It will currently show a broken-looking empty panel if you (the host) are a spectator on a map with bots disabled.

data.title: Repair activity breaks service depot selling
data.body:
The repair activity is run on the _unit_ being repaired, and calls `INotifyRepair` on the host building each tick.  `WithRepairAnimation` implements this interface and plays a custom animation that overrides the packing animation and leaves the building in a locked state.

This is similar to #6766.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/7363700-repair-activity-breaks-service-depot-selling?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add Wanders trait and make AttackWander inherit that
data.body:
The idea is to make wandering more generic. Now we can have both AttackMove-wandering and simple Move-wandering.
I'm aware that currently only `AttackWander` inherits the new `Wanders` trait, but I have another use for it on another branch that will wait for this to be merged.

data.title: Add a method to access files via virtual names (alias)
data.body:
it sounds stupid and make for the first moment not realy sense but this pr adds support for virtual filenames :)
We can specify an alias for a file which has maybe the same name but must be "unique" (eva & cabal voices).
so we can flag them with an alias:

example:

filename: 
`Speech01.mix -> I001.aud` as alias `eva-i001`
`Speech02.mix -> I001.aud` as alias `cab-i001`

in my testcase i had modified MixFile.cs and printed the `Add()` to debug.log:

```
Added Alias [scores] for [scores.mix]
Added Alias [sidenc01] for [sidenc01.mix]
Added Alias [sidenc02] for [sidenc02.mix]
Added Alias [gmenu] for [gmenu.mix]
Added Alias [e01scd01] for [e01scd01.mix]
Added Alias [e01scd02] for [e01scd02.mix]
Added Alias [maps01] for [maps01.mix]
Added Alias [maps02] for [maps02.mix]
Added Alias [movies01] for [movies01.mix]
Added Alias [movies02] for [movies02.mix]
Added Alias [multi] for [multi.mix]
Added Alias [patch] for [patch.mix]
Added Alias [sidecd01] for [sidecd01.mix]
Added Alias [sidecd02] for [sidecd02.mix]
Added Alias [tibsun] for [tibsun.mix]
Added Alias [cache] for [cache.mix]
Added Alias [conquer] for [conquer.mix]
Added Alias [isosnow] for [isosnow.mix]
Added Alias [isotemp] for [isotemp.mix]
Added Alias [local] for [local.mix]
Added Alias [sidec01] for [sidec01.mix]
Added Alias [sidec02] for [sidec02.mix]
Added Alias [sno] for [sno.mix]
Added Alias [snow] for [snow.mix]
Added Alias [sounds] for [sounds.mix]
Added Alias [speech01] for [speech01.mix]
Added Alias [tem] for [tem.mix]
Added Alias [temperat] for [temperat.mix]
Added Alias [scores01] for [scores01.mix]
Added Alias [expand01] for [expand01.mix]
Added Alias [sounds01] for [sounds01.mix]
Added Alias [e01sc01] for [e01sc01.mix]
Added Alias [e01sc02] for [e01sc02.mix]
Added Alias [e01vox01] for [e01vox01.mix]
Added Alias [e01vox02] for [e01vox02.mix]
Added Alias [ecache01] for [ecache01.mix]
```

As we see we could load all voice files inside `(speech01.mix)` as `gdi-****` and all files in `speech02.mix` as ``nod-****` which can result in `Player.Race + "-I001"`.

Also we should access tileset related building-SHPs via Aliases :)

data.title: Add worms to d2k maps and add lobby option to disable them
data.body: Fixes #7124.

data.title: Actors can't force-fire on actors they can board
data.body:
Couldn't find a duplicate, so opening a new one.
Actors can't force-attack actors they can board. This was true for all types of transports I tested.
